isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - INSTALL - LEFT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Move the left countershaft assembly to the rear and insert the countershaft support tool or blocking to center the shaft in the rear case bore ( Figure 214).

figure.caption: Figure 214. Move Left Countershaft Assembly to Rear

step1.para: Use a flanged end bearing driver to completely seat the front bearing or bearing outer race in the case bore ( Figure 215).

figure.caption: Figure 215. Seat Front Bearing or Bearing Outer Race in Case Bore

step1.para: Position the retainer plate on the front of the left countershaft, roll pin in the hole at the end of the shaft, and secure with a bolt ( Figure 216). Tighten to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 216. Tighten Bolt to Secure Retainer Plate on Front of Left Countershaft

step1.para: Remove countershaft support tool or blocking from rear case bore and install the left countershaft rear bearing with the larger I.D. lead chamfer to the front of the shaft. Install the snap ring in the groove at the rear of the left countershaft ( Figure 217).

figure.caption: Figure 217. Install Snap Ring in Groove at Left Countershaft Rear
